The Drama Barn is back for Summer term with a standout comedy. We sent Stella Newing to check out how The Barn deals with the sunshine.

Opera North continue a fantastic season with this production of Salome. Andreane Rellou takes a look at this fascinating production.

Theatre Review: Hymn To Love

York Theatre Royal brings to its studio a portrayal of one of the most exemplary singers of all-time. We sent Rudolf Barney-Seabra to see if this replication stands up to the original.

The classic Oscar Wilde play has been revived at York Theatre Royal this sunny Spring weekend, so we sent Ruth Lee to see if this new production stands out.

At York Theatre Royal this week there is a show that tells a fascinating story of war. We sent Rudolf Barney-Seabra to give us his thoughts.

The Drama Barn has taken on a challenging production of a modern Russian political play. We sent Rachel Sanders along to find out how they got on.

The York University Gilbert & Sullivan Society are challenged with updating one of the most politically dated G&S classics. We sent Kendra Rabbitts to find out how they managed it.

National Theatre's critically-acclaimed touring production of Hedda Gabler has finally came to York. Ellie Ward gives us her report on this modern classic.

It is singing nuns and tough gangsters abounds as CHMS bring the classic musical Sister Act to York. We sent Andreane Rellou to find out how they got on.

Stella Newing wonders if we're approaching an age of art censorship.

Taking on the issues surrounding high school life with dark comedy and dance numbers, Hannah Paish went to see how The Drama Barn took on this modern cult comedy.

The Drama Barn is transformed this week into a World War One bunker as Rachael Cheesman checks out Dramasoc's latest production.

Confronting The Past

Charlie Ralph states the importance of engaging with the works of artists in the Holocaust.

Theatre Review: Yes, Prime Minister

Politically corruption runs amok in The Drama Barn this week in this adaptation of a classic British sitcom. Oscar Bentley went to find out how it measures up.
